snippet: In an ad campaign using the old-fashioned medium of prime-time TV, Google is promoting its browser, Chrome, in the belief that it will benefit Google search.

headline.main: Google Takes to TV to Promote Browser
headline.print_headline: Google Takes to TV to Promote Browser

snippet: Planetary, a new free application for the iPad, allows people to navigate their music collection in a unique and visually appealing way.

snippet: Samsung is spending $3.6 billion to expand its Austin, Tex., plant to 2.3 million square feet, one the largest factories of any kind in North America.

headline.main: To Meet Demand for Chips, Samsung Bets Big on Austin
headline.print_headline: To Meet Demand For Chips, Samsung Bets Big on Austin

snippet: The European justice commissioner plans to propose tougher rules on breaches of privacy, setting standards that could be followed in the United States.

headline.main: Europe Leads in Pushing for Privacy of User Data
headline.print_headline: Europe Leads In Pushing For Privacy Of User Data

snippet: Teach for America is the latest organization to reimburse employees with domestic partners for the extra costs they must pay for health insurance.

snippet: Google's mobile advertising unit, AdMob, illegally collected users' location data without users' consent, the police said.
